page.title: 05HISTORY OF SUTTON MILL DAM
page.content: Sutton Mill Dam is between Clock Face Road and Ellamsbridge Road. In 1845 there were only two dams, Sutton Mill Dam and Dam House Dam. Both dams had two main functions which were:- 1) to supply water power for a corn mill at the head of Sutton Mill Dam, 2) to provide a supply of water for a plate glass firm. This glass company had closed down by 1864. After the First World War there was a campaign to attract new industry to St. Helens. In 1934 British Sidac took over a site at Lancots Lane and Cellophane was produced there. Large amounts of water were necessary for the production of cellophane. It was fed into a holding dam at Ellamsbridge Road and then piped into the factory. Records of the dam have been found from the eighteenth century.
